TopicTitle: I need help with hiding the icons on my desktop background

Articles.Content:
You know this;

How do I hide the icons a the left? I just want to see the picture and nothing else without deleting them. Btw, this isn't my desktop, I pulled this off of Google images.

Edited April 9, 2016 by Spaceception
I'm no expert, but I believe the image files used for the backgrounds are somewhere in your documents. If you go to change it, it should give you a destination.

Just now, Maximus97 said:

I'm no expert, but I believe the image files used for the backgrounds are somewhere in your documents. If you go to change it, it should give you a destination.

Alright, thanks, I'll go try it

Looks like Windows 7 or higher. I don't think you can do that. In the older versions you could (auto-arrange off, obviously) create a temporary icon, put it in the center, select all icons, move the temporary one to the edge (and the rest off-screen) and then delete the temporary one. But newer versions of windows prevent you from moving the icons off screen.

If your graphics card driver comes with a multiple desktop app (a lot of them do) you could create a second desktop without any icons.

Or you could move them all into a "desktop" folder on your desktop, minimizing the number of icons down to one.

Just now, Kerbart said:

Or you could move them all into a "desktop" folder on your desktop, minimizing the number of icons down to one.

I've only been able to do that for 2, the others won't go.
For Windows 7, right click on the desktop, select "View" from the context menu, and deselect the "show desktop icons" option.

Just now, Ten Key said:

For Windows 7, right click on the desktop, select "View" from the context menu, and deselect the "show desktop icons" option.

It's a windows 8

1 hour ago, Spaceception said:

It's a windows 8

 

Just attempted and it works for Win 8 as well.

Right-click on desktop > View > Show desktop icons

 

 

Though personally, I start by keeping the desktop uncluttered, and maintain it by moving extra icons into a folder next to the recycle bin.

Edited April 9, 2016 by Slam_Jones

57 minutes ago, Slam_Jones said:

Though personally, I start by keeping the desktop uncluttered, and maintain it by moving extra icons into a folder next to the recycle bin.

My desktop was really messy a few weeks ago. It now consists of a shortcut to Hamachi, a pictures folder, a games folder (game folders have custom icons), and the trash. It's so much nicer than a half full desktop consisting of outdated mods, old installs, and Minecraft/Unturned saves.
